intro: Ornithopteris obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its floating, oval-shaped leaves that are typically divided into four lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and marshes. Its reproductive structures, including small, yellowish sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Ornithopteris obovata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
